document.docAuthor: Chu, Chang, Yao, Zhiyuan, Wongprom, Prasit & Li, Shuqiang
document.docTitle: Changminia dao Chu & Yao & Wongprom & Li 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Changminia gen. nov., a new genus of daddy-long-leg spiders (Araneae: Pholcidae) from karst caves in Southeast Asia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Changminia gen. nov., a new genus of daddy-long-leg spiders (Araneae: Pholcidae) from karst caves in Southeast Asia

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 4. Changminia dao sp. nov., holotype male (IZCAS-Ar 42496). A–B. Pedipalp (A. Prolateral view; B. Retrolateral view); C–D. Distal part of procursus (C. Prolateral view, arrows 1 and 2 indicate elongated prolatero-subdistal apophysis and dorso-distal protrusion, respectively; D. Dorsal view). b = bulb, e = embolus, pr = procursus. Scale bars: 0.10 (A–B), 0.05 (C–D).
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 5. Changminia dao sp. nov., holotype male (D–H, IZCAS-Ar 42496) and paratype female (A–C, I–J; IZCAS-Ar 42497). A–B. External female genitalia (A. Ventral view; B. Lateral view); C. Vulva, dorsal view, arrow indicates nearly nshaped sclerite; D. Bulb, prolateral view; E–F. Chelicerae (E. Frontal view, arrow indicates blunt proximal part; F. Lateral view); G–J. Habitus (G, I. Dorsal view; H. Lateral view; J. Ventral view). b = bulb, da = distal apophysis, e = embolus, ma = median apophysis, fa = frontal apophysis, pa = proximo-lateral apophysis. Scale bars: 0.10 (A–F), 0.30 (G–J).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype :
male (IZCAS-Ar 42496), Dao Cave ( 12°35.400′N , 99°43.800′E ,
elevation 123 m
), Nong Phlap Subdistrict , Hua Hin District ,
Prachuap Kiri Khan
,
Thailand
,
30 October 2014
, P. Wongprom leg.
Paratype :
1 female (IZCAS-Ar 42497), same data as holotype
.
Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition and refers to the type locality.

Diagnosis. This species can be easily distinguished from
C. huangdi ( Tong & Li, 2009 )
comb. nov.
by procursus with elongated prolatero-subdistal apophysis (arrow 1 in Fig. 4C ; prolatero-subdistal apophysis short and pointed in
C. huangdi
, arrow in Fig. 2C ), without dorsal apophysis ( Fig. 4D ; with pointed dorsal apophysis in
C. huangdi
, arrow in Fig. 2D ), by procursus dorso-distally strongly protruding (arrow 2 in Fig. 4C ; not protruding in
C. huangdi
, Fig. 2C ), by male chelicerae blunt proximally (arrow in Fig. 5E ; pointed in
C. huangdi
, arrow in Fig. 3C ), with frontal apophyses (fa in Fig. 5E ; absent in
C. huangdi
) and distal apophyses long, with sclerotized cones, serrated in lateral view (da in Fig. 5E ; distal apophyses short cone-shaped in
C. huangdi
, da in Fig. 3C ), and by external female genitalia with large, proximally wide and distally sharply narrow median apophysis (ma in Figs 5A–C ; median apophysis small in
C. huangdi
, ma in Fig. 3A ).
Natural history. The species was found in the aphotic zone inside the cave.
Distribution. Thailand (Prachuap Kiri Khan, type locality; Fig. 1 ).
